sentence.text: Patient 5 had maxillar and mandibular hypoplasia and a submucous cleft palate.
He needed a tracheostoma for airway management up to the age of 5 years.
Ears were small, low set and dysplastic, with an atresia of the auditory canals (Fig. 1c).
The right arm showed severe radial and ulnar hypoplasia and thumb aplasia (Fig. 2i, j), the left arm a mild radial hypoplasia and thumb aplasia as well.
The fourth and fifth toes were bilaterally short (Fig. 3b).
In addition, the patient had a complete atrioventricular septal defect and a marked hypoplasia of the deltoid and rotator cuff muscles
